result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna L Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Submit DNA sample (if not done so already) and pay surcharge.  *Comnply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent.  *No contact with victim K.E.G.  (6/15/16: amended to change victim to correct initials)
**6/29/16:  Judgment amended to remove payment plan and the $15 fee as that was assessed and entered on case 16CT32.  smr

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anna L Garza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Anna L Garza in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CT32 & 16CM19 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 16CM19 & Ct. 1 in 16CT32.    State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Atty Zamzow agrees.  Defendant agrees.  
 Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.      Atty Zamzow enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.  Court questions defendant regarding plea.
   Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  16CT32:  Ct. 1:  Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge

16CM19:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample (if not done so already) + Surcharge =  $200.00
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
No contact with the victom C.G.
Credit = 0 days
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $25.00/month commencing in July

**Note:  Victim initials entered incorrectly:  should be K.E.G.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CT32 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussion on possible settlement but asks for more time.  Atty Zamzow agrees and states that 16CT32 is tracking with.

BY THE COURT:  Set Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Return date on May 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with Christine Garza

Defendant Anna L Garza in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking. 
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and states that the PD office appointed Atty Zamzow.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
*No contact with Christine Garza


  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant will get PD appointment.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
